intro: Dorstenia hildebrandtii var. schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's woodspurry, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and sought-after specimen in botanical gardens and collections.
